channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: US attorney general vows to appeal dismissal of criminal cases against James Comey and Letitia James – US politics live
item.description: The Pentagon is investigating the Arizona lawmaker for possible breaches of military law after he took part in a video calling for US troops to refuse...

item.title: White House claims ‘tremendous progress’ made in Ukraine-Russia peace plan but says more talks needed - Europe live
item.description: Spokesperson says sensitive issues still need to be discussed between Ukraine, Russia and the US In other EU related news, a top European court on Tue...

item.title: ‘Queen of the Zoo’: Gramma, tortoise who lived through two world wars, dies aged 141
item.description: Zoo officials said Gramma came to the San Diego Zoo from Bronx Zoo in 1928 or 1931 and lived through 20 US presidents After more than a century of mun...

item.title: US optimistic over Ukraine peace deal talks but ‘a few delicate details’ remain
item.description: Ukrainian official cites ‘common understanding’, but no sign territorial concessions or security guarantees are agreed Europe live – latest updates Di...

item.title: Seven killed in Kyiv as Russia hits Ukraine’s energy sector with missiles and drones
item.description: Wide-ranging assault included drones that crossed into Romanian and Moldovan territory Europe live – latest updates Russia launched a massive missile ...

item.title: Red Cross receives coffin said to contain Gaza hostage's body
item.description: The remains will be transferred to Israeli forces, who will take them to Israel's forensic medicine institute for identification.

item.title: Jury trials could be scrapped in England and Wales except for most serious cases
item.description: Only cases of alleged murder, rape or manslaughter will be decided by a jury under new proposals to cut court backlogs.

item.title: Graham Linehan cleared of harassing trans activist but guilty of damaging phone
item.description: Comedy writer Graham Linehan "deliberately whacked" a teenage trans woman's phone out of her hand, a court heard.

item.title: Four new arrests made following Louvre jewellery heist
item.description: Two men and two women from Paris are the latest to be questioned as part of the ongoing investigation.

item.title: Same-sex marriage must be respected throughout EU, top court tells Poland
item.description: The ruling covers the case of a Polish couple who married in Berlin but Polish authorities refused to recognise their marriage.
